greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, such that the binomial transform of the n-th row lists the m-dimensional partitions of n, for n>=1 and m>=0.
comment: The n-th row equals the inverse binomial transform of n-th column of square array A096751, for n>=1. The zero-dimensional partition of n is taken to be 1 for all n.
link: S. Govindarajan, Notes on higher-dimensional partitions, arXiv:1203.4419
example: The number of m-dimensional partitions of 5, for m>=0, is given by the binomial transform of the 5th row:
The inverse binomial transform of the diagonals of this triangle begin:
xref: Cf. A096751, A096807 (row sums), A000065 (column k=1?), A008778 (bin trans 4th row), A042984 (bin trans 6th row)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 19 2004
